intro: Saussurea deserticola, commonly known as the desert saffron, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its tall, sparsely branched stems and yellow to orange-colored flower heads. The plant is adapted to harsh desert conditions, with deep roots and reduced leaf surface to minimize water loss. Its flowers are typically visited by pollinators such as bees and butterflies, contributing to its ecological role in its native habitat. The plant is also valued for its medicinal properties in traditional medicine.
